intro: Aulomyrcia venulosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid environments. Aulomyrcia venulosa is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
